content.description: Stand-start with your right hand on a crimpy undercling and your left on a crimper rail, then make a large move to a sloper, go straight up the arete from there, and top out a little further left.
content.protection: Two pads and a good spot.
content.location: This is the far right arete on the Exercise Boulder. It is the orange line.

content.description: Start on a left hand crimp and a right hand sloper, then move up and left on good crimps.
content.location: If you're at the Exercise Boulder, it's a smaller boulder behind and a little to the left of you. The problem is the left side of the main face.

content.description:
Use the same start as

Jogging

, just keep going right until you reach the arete, then go up.
content.protection: Two pads or one pad and a spotter.
content.location: It is the green line on the Exercise Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on two jugs, then make a larger move right. Once you are at the next set of jugs, go straight up on good crimps.
content.protection: One or two pads, and a spot for the topout.
content.location: This is the main line in blue on the Exercise Boulder, which is the main boulder with an overhang on the front side.

content.description: The Illuminati is a fun problem with jugs at the beginning then a topout crux - the farther right you go once at the top, the easier it gets.
content.protection: One or two pads and a good spotter for the top.
content.location: If you're at the Exercise Boulder, look behind you to see a triangular boulder. The problem is on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on two crimps, move your feet up, make a big move to a jug, then top out on some good crimps.
content.location: This is the far right problem in red on the Exercise Boulder.

content.description: Start with both of your hands on the lower rail and your foot out right. Work your way through the line with a series of large bumps and some funky foot beta. It isn't over until you get to the jug at the end. Carefully downclimb the south face.
content.location: From the cliff, look down into the valley for the cluster of the biggest boulders. It is located on the east face of the middle boulder. Hike down the hill on a very faint trail, or find your own way down. Watch out for cactus and loose footing.

content.description: Start standing with two painful pockets (bring tape), cross over into a deep, triangle-shaped pocket, then get a final super positive crimp for your right hand. Smear your left foot, and make a hard throw to the ledge, hand-foot match, and make a balancy move to the topout.
content.protection: You can't bring enough pads, the landing is perfectly situated above a large rock. Good spotters are necessary here too.
content.location:
This is just to the left of

Bend the Knee

.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a bad sloper, then move up and right to a crimp, then a jug, then the lip.
content.protection: One pad, and watch out for the rock next you.
content.location:
This is the problem to the right of

The Wookie

. It is marked in red.

content.description: Climb the arete, and transition onto the face on the left side of the arete. Keep it together on perfect crimps to the top. It is possible that this had been done before, I am not sure this is a first ascent. This is one of the best problems in the area according to some.
content.protection: LOTS OF PADS and a competent spotter, the landing is sketchy with large rock. Or grow a pair, and go old school.
content.location:
It is on the large boulder to the North of

Hamstringer

.
